tweet: Sunglasses are a great fashion accessory, but they also have a very important function! 😎 When purchasing sunglasses, look for ones that block out 99-100% of both UVA and UVB radiation, so you can keep your vision sharp and eyes healthy. #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/vMXSDqH4qJ

Did you know bananas are a nutritional powerhouse, packed with energy-giving carbohydrates?🍌🍌 Loaded with valuable micronutrients, including potassium which is an important electrolyte in the body, helping to regulate heart function as well as fluid balance. #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/uNy25tIZv4

As the weather cools down, don't miss the last important moments of the holidays! With our app, you can access an online consultation with an experienced doctor at a time that suits you so that you don't have to miss the important moments. #feelbettertoday pic.twitter.com/mGTdENIYfV

In honor of all of the wonderful women of the UAE, happy Emirati Women's Day from the Health at Hand team!#emirati #womensday #emiratiwomensday #UAE #celebration #28august #healthathand pic.twitter.com/fOMBohOJeK

Do you know the importance of encouraging children to drink water? Drinking water is the best way to quench your thirst. It doesn’t come with all the sugar and energy found in fruit juice drinks, soft drinks, sports drinks and flavoured mineral waters! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/pAGC3tuBm7

Looking to have a visit to a specialist? If you have UAE insurance, our qualified doctors can now refer you to a specialist after an online video consultation with them using the DHA online system. So that you can see the person you need effortlessly. #feelbettertoday pic.twitter.com/Nzp6nGZlc5

What exactly does being mindful mean?Mindfulness is the basic human ability to be fully present, aware of where we are and what we’re doing, and not overly reactive or overwhelmed by what’s going on around us. #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/gsC1u8ZUFV

You know, there's a reason Popeye always ate spinach! 🌱Spinach is known for its abilities to restore energy, increase vitality & improve quality of blood. This is due to spinach being rich in iron, which plays a central role in the function of red blood cells. #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/9ACfe490fX

When children spend time in front of small screens, it takes away from time they could be spending being active. Being too sedentary has been shown to be linked to children being overweight, in particular with children who watch TV for more than 2 hours a day. #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/dz2stcT2jh

Coconut, fruit and chia seeds? How could this recipe not be delicious! These @waitrose snack bars are perfect for when you're craving something sweet! As the school year slowly approaches and the time to start buying a new year's uniform comes ever closer we thought we'd share some important growth facts with you!👦The average child grows 6-7cm each year!👧They also gain around 2-3kg per year! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/N7JCXOE8Ul

This is your Friday morning reminder to MOVE!💃Although relaxation and down-time is important, it is equally important to spend time exercising your body. Just thirty minutes a day can increase your mobility, heart function, and overall body health! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/W1aZNUWPNy

Salmon is an incredible superfood! It's nutrient dense, an excellent source of high-quality protein, vitamins and minerals and has a high content of omega-3 fatty acid, which makes salmon such a valuable ‘brain food’. #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/sq8V0OIEHV

Do you know what to do if your child gets a nosebleed? We recommend that you sit straight, pinch the nose just above the nostrils for 10-15 minutes, lean forward and breathe through the mouth! If they are regular we recommend seeing a doctor. #feelbettertoday #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/CYgfntH9EI

Healthier than ice cream but just as delicious and children won't notice the difference? This @jamieoliver recipe is a must-try! Add 1 ripe banana400g ripe seasonal fruit, 1tbs honey, 500g natural yoghurt & 150g raspberries into a processor, then freeze! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/hl9qBqfuAs

@GulfNews Can you tell the difference between a holiday myth and fact?🌴🌏✈ We spoke to @gulfnews last week about the top five!  You can check out the article via  https://gulfnews.com/guides/life/summer-health-5-myths-vs-facts-1.2259934 …! #handyhealthtips #onlinedoctors pic.twitter.com/oK3sAInQCu

Knowing how safe the water is in the country you're travelling to is incredibly important. Here are some of our top tips: don't drink tap water or use it to brush your teeth & avoid uncooked fruits & veg as they may have been washed in unsafe water. #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/rQh4vVrzhp

This weekend, take a moment for yourself to be calm and relax, it'll make you feel good! 🙆 Relaxing also has some other health benefits such as slowing down your heart rate, lowering your blood pressure & improving digestion! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/ozuEY3ZdZQ

Blueberries are an excellent source of vitamin C soluble fibre & phytochemicals which are responsible for the blue colouring. Phytochemicals have been extensively researched for their antioxidant action that helps protect the body against diseases! #handyhealthtips #blueberries pic.twitter.com/wkUMxHDEOt

Did you know that 70% of sore throats come from viral infections? One of our experienced Health at Hand Doctors, Dr. Ruhil, talks about sore throats and how to recognise the symptoms. If your child has a sore throat, get them seen by a doctor. #feelbettertoday #sorethroat pic.twitter.com/hDlNzQKfI5

@EatingWell Looking for some healthy dinner inspiration? We love this Zucchini Noodles with Avocado Pest and Shrimp recipe from @eatingwell. You can find the recipe at:  http://www.eatingwell.com/recipe/257004/zucchini-noodles-with-avocado-pesto-shrimp/ … Enjoy! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/OycGsVzn6i

Avoiding mosquito bites should always be considered, especially if travelling to an area where mosquito-born infections are common. DEET is considered the most effective repellent against mosquito bites and should be applied to all exposed areas of the body! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/WIRduD0JCN

🥨Let's talk about carbs! Carbs are an essential macro-nutrient in order to allow your body to function properly, so should not be removed from a person's daily food intake! White bread does offer less fiber than wholegrain so opt for high-fiber when possible! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/RRcGl4G3MC

Take the stairs🏃Choosing the stairs over an elevator can have multiple health benefits for you including improving your cardiovascular fitness and relieving your stress through increasing endorphins, putting you in a better mood to start your day! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/9SjXxP1sAn

Always aim to eat a rainbow!🥑🍅🥕By eating a multicoloured plate, you ensure that you are including all your vitamins and minerals that your body needs in order to keep you healthy. #handyhealthtips #eatarainbow pic.twitter.com/R2ar6jqzuZ

This melon and crunch bran pot is the perfect combination of sweet and healthy! Place 100g melon in a bowl or glass jar, add 150g yoghurt over the top, then sprinkle over some cereal mixed with seeds. Drizzle over honey and enjoy! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/nNg6aXPSRh

Are you unsure on what to do if you get burnt? DO stop the burning cause as quickly as possible & cool the burn with lukewarm running water. DON'T use ice water!If your burn is large we recommend seeking medical advice immediately. #feelbettertoday #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/F560J1mKH5

@DubaiMumsSay We love these Popsicles from @dubaimumssay! The perfect breakfast or snack item!🍧Ingredients:1 1/2 cups pineapple1 cup banana1/2 cup water1/2 cup milk1 Scoop vanilla protein powderBlend all the ingredients and freeze them, then eat! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/LGOyFxneCy

Do you miss your stretches before your workout? Not sure why they're important? Stretching improves flexibility, increasing the ability of joints to move through their full range of motion; how far they can bend, twist and reach! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/qdNaGp0zav

🍅 In a salad, grilled, or in a sauce! Tomatoes are the major dietary source of the antioxidant lycopene, which has been linked to many health benefits, including reduced risk of heart disease & cancer. They are also a great source of vitamin C, potassium, folate & vitamin K! pic.twitter.com/3nt0GmXDn9

Let's talking about bruising! Bruises are bluish or purple patches that appear on the skin when tiny blood vessels break. You can treat bruises on your skin by limiting the bleeding with a cold compress or an ice pack wrapped in a towel! #handyhealthtips #onlinedoctors pic.twitter.com/qBtdB0oLxa

Dr. Ramy explained HEALTH, a great acronym for: Hydrating, Eating light, Avoiding sun, Light travel, Talking to your doctor & Hydrating! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/ge5nJvBJMD

🌡Fevers are defined as a body temperature over 37 degrees. They are the immune response to viruses, bacteria or fungi, and are often the first warning sign of an illness. If your child develops a fever, we recommend consulting a doctor. #feelbettertoday #onlinedoctors pic.twitter.com/76rD6hdbMT

🍉Watermelon is the perfect summer snack; refreshing and delicious! Watermelon is 92% water & so is rehydrating & can help you feel fuller for longer!Watermelon also contains vitamins and minerals such as Vitamin C, A, B6, Potassium and Magnesium!#handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/Z6ljuZ1WOh
Thanks for the review @Friday_Magazine happy weekend!

Namaste!🤸♀Yoga is an ancient form of exercise that originated in India about 5,000 years ago! It focuses on your strength, flexibility, and breathing, to boost physical and mental wellbeing! #feelbettertoday pic.twitter.com/kin1cD2lZW

Are you unsure on what to do for your headache?  Drink plenty of water & get plenty of rest & relaxation. Don't sleep more than you usually would, & try and prevent eye strain! If your headache seems more intense than normal we recommend contacting a doctor! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/cyVZrAqBMZ

Need a midweek pick-me-up? We have the perfect recipe! from @bbcgoodfood for these healthy pancakes! Stack them high with fresh berries and a spoonful of low-fat yogurt! Find the recipe at:  https://www.bbcgoodfood.com/recipes/healthy-pancakes … Enjoy! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/GdL4odG5vl

Should you be drinking dairy? As long as there are no intolerances we recommend keeping it in your diet. It's one of the most nutrient-rich and complete food groups, containing calcium, protein, phosphorus, potassium, and vitamins A, B12, D and riboflavin! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/8PDV1AYXCc

Our bodies are an incredible 60% water! 🚰 Did you know that even as little as 2% hydration can cause a decrease in your performance, memory and concentration? We find that adding marker points for every hour of the day helps us hit that goal of around 2 litres a day!💪 pic.twitter.com/iNlxZHNXcM

"Have lots of Vitamin C to prevent a cold!" We've all heard it being said, but is it actually true? No, it's a myth! While large doses can increase your white blood cell count & speed up recovery time from a cold, it may not actually prevent a cold from occuring! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/7IeB9xD20T
Dr Ramy explains how @myhealthathand  helps reassure new mums @PearlFMUAE pic.twitter.com/Js6rmfkDS7

Heading on holiday soon? Want to know what our doctors pack in their travel kits? Paracetamol, oral rehydration tablets, antihistamine, antiseptic cream, suncream, mosquito repellent & water purification tablets! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/1mJjEeovud

🌾Did you know that hay fever's scientific name is allergic rhinitis? Hay fever is usually worse between late March & September, as this is when the pollen count is highest. Our top tips to try & reduce symptoms is vacuum regularly and dust with a damp cloth! #handyhealthtip pic.twitter.com/IxIL732HD7

@RipeFresh We loved this refreshing recipe for kiwi popsicles from @ripefresh. Perfect for the summertime and healthy too! Blend 4 kiwis, lime juice, coconut milk, honey and vanilla extract in a blender until frothy. Pour the mixture into the mould and freeze! #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/njrIC63s92

Weekend = Me Time 💆Good self-care can prevent, or reduce most health problems, including mental health issues. A healthy diet and regular exercise are all important, but effective self-care is also about pampering yourself from time to time!  #feelbettertoday #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/j7X2mUYOGD

Peanuts are packed with protein and fiber, which can actually improve satiety and maintain weight loss. The recommended daily servings are a handful of peanuts (1-2 ounces depending on your size) or 2 tablespoons of peanut butter. #handyhealthtips #feelbettertoday pic.twitter.com/awS6kC4x69

Unsure of the difference between a cold and the flu? A cold comes on gradually, whereas the flu will onset abruptly. You can experience a fever, headaches and muscle pain with the flu, and will more likely experience a stuffy nose and sore throat with a cold. #handyhealthtips pic.twitter.com/LmL93mtHi3

Do you want to start your day with a healthy organic green juice? Grab lettuce leaves, fennel, cucumber, ginger, banana, pea potein, chlorella, and honey and some ice and blend; then pour in a jar! Have a fantastic day ahead!#handyhealthtips #feelbettertoday #healthyrecipes pic.twitter.com/dEwG7LmbBj
